intro: Phlegmariurus polycarpos, commonly known as the broad-leaved clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiales. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has needle-like leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern around its stem. Its reproductive structures, called strobili, are cone-like and contain the spore-producing organs. Phlegmariurus polycarpos plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
